author: IGN
description:
This video contains spoilers for Alien: Earth Season 1.

Who are the real monsters on Alien: Earth? That’s literally the title of the final episode of Season 1, “The Real Monsters,” but it’s also the theme the whole season has been playing with on FX and Hulu – or at least, one of the big ones. There are the obvious monsters, of course, like the xenomorph and everyone’s fave horrible octopus thing, the Eye. But as usual for the Alien franchise, those are mostly external factors causing stress on the more human and synth characters, leading to a big question at the end of the season as to whether the monsters have lost the delicate game being played, or if they’ve taken over the asylum.

Written by Noah Hawley and Migizi Pensoneau, and directed by Dana Gonzales, the surprisingly short finale has a lot going on. But what does it all mean for The Lost Boys, led by Wendy (Sydney Chandler), as well as their human (and xenomorph) counterparts? And how can this all connect to the Alien movie
title: Alien: Earth Season 1 Ending Explained – How It Can All Fit Into the Movie Universe

author: IGN
description:
In this Hollow Knight: Silksong boss fight you can find on the Wish Board in Bellhart, we take on the Savage Beastfly for the second time. We did not use tools for this fight and only have one Nail upgrade at this point, but depending on what you've acquired by now (and what Crest you're using), you could certainly use Tacks/Pollip Pouch/Weighted Belt/Cogfly if you have any of them. The Weighted Belt can be especially useful here to hold your ground when you're on the edge of the platform. The whole ballgame here is move as little as possible so you can better know where the Beastfly will go next, and then always prioritize enemy spawns when they occur.

Loadout
Savage Beastfly (Grand Hunt)
Crest: Hunter
Throwable: Longpin
Ability: Silkspear
Tools: Druid's Eye, Weavelight, Cogwork Wheel, Compass, Magnetite Brooch

For more info on Hollow Knight: Silksong, head to our wiki @ https://www.ign.com/wikis/hollow-knight-silksong

#IGN #Gaming
title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Boss Fight - Savage Beastfly (Grand Hunt, Far Fields)

author: IGN
description:
Take a look at the Queen Teaser Trailer for Marvel Animation’s Marvel Zombies, an animated horror installment to the Marvel Cinematic Universe distributed by Marvel Studios. This series re-contextualizes the Marvel Universe as Earth's mightiest heroes go head-to-head against a zombie outbreak, turning even the strongest of them into undead nightmares. Marvel Animation’s Marvel Zombies will be a four-part event on September 24, streaming exclusively on Disney+.

After the Avengers are overtaken by a zombie plague, a desperate group of survivors discover the key to bringing an end to the super-powered undead, racing across a dystopian landscape and risking life and limb to save their world. 
 
Marvel Zombies stars Elizabeth Olsen, Paul Rudd, Florence Pugh, David Harbour, Tessa Thompson, Simu Liu, Awkwafina, Hailee Steinfeld, Wyatt Russell, Randall Park, Iman Vellani, Dominique Thorne, and more. The series is executive produced by Kevin Feige, Louis D’Esposito, Brad Winderbaum, Dana Vasq
title: Marvel Animation’s Marvel Zombies - Official Queen Teaser Trailer (2025) Elizabeth Olsen, Paul Rudd

author: IGN
description:
Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles reviewed by Ronny Barrier on PlayStation 5, also available on Xbox, PC, and Switch 1 & 2.

The next time I come back to replay my all-time favorite video game, Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles is the version I’ll be reaching for. Its fantastic story of intrigue and betrayal mixed with one of the most satisfying RPG job systems around have endured the test of time. This is a mostly by-the-book remake, and it can’t quite be called a complete or definitive edition due to not including all content from all versions (and not doing enough to address the endgame imbalances of the original), but sometimes less is more. Stripping away the cruft of Final Fantasy Tactics while surfacing what made it special through smart UI tweaks, convenience features, and excellent new voice acting brings it almost completely up to date. It reminded me of why it was so amazing in the first place and allows me to confidently recommend it to newcomers wi
title: Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles Review

author: IGN
description:
Here's your look at the Animula Nook reveal trailer for the upcoming fantasy, life simulation game set in a lilliputian world. Step into the whimsical world of Animula in the announcement trailer, which showcases colorful landscapes, cute residents, and more. Animula Nook will be available on Steam, Epic Games Store, PlayStation, Nintendo Switch 2, and Mac.

Inspired by the charm of modern animated cartoons, Animula Nook transforms everyday objects into fantastical landscapes. From towering coffee mugs to sprawling bookshelves, players become tiny explorers in a giant’s world. They can navigate and interact with oversized, real-world objects, build their own homestead, collect elements such as raindrops and wind to help with crafting, and grow crops in flowerpots.
title: Animula Nook - Official Reveal Trailer

author: IGN
description: It may come as no surprise, but the end that most players reach first in Hollow Knight Silksong is not actually the true ending of the game. To get that, you'll need to do a bit of extra work cleaning up Pharloom and helping its denizens by fulfilling their wishes, among other things. Here's everything you need to do to unlock act 3 in Silksong and get on the right path to reach the true end.
title: Hollow Knight Silksong - How to Reach Act 3 and Get on the Path to the True End

author: IGN
description:
Skate Early Access reviewed by Luke Reilly on PC. Also available on Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, and PlayStation 4/5.

"If I said there weren’t times while playing the new early access Skate when I found myself hooked on clearing a task, or engaged in executing an impromptu line I’d challenged myself to make, I’d be lying. Thanks in large part to its smooth controls, it is true that cruising around in Skate does have the capacity to tickle the dusty part of my brain that still delights in booting up Skate 2 every now and then, just to turn back the clock, noodle around, and unwind. However, these moments are fleeting. Skate is just so aggressively different in tone, style, and spirit from its ancestors that any brief trance I found myself in was constantly broken by its embarrassing dialogue, trite art style, and sterile, mobile game-style progression. Arming Skate with a faithful facsimile of the incredible feel of old games means little if the rest of it is constantly turning me off.
title: Skate Early Access Review

author: IGN

#IGN
title: Who is Jeremy Allen White's Rotta the Hutt in The Mandalorian and Grogu trailer? #starwars #movie

author: IGN
description:
It’s been nearly six years since Disney released a new Star Wars movie in theaters, and finally, that drought is about to end. The studio just released the first trailer for The Mandalorian and Grogu, the big-screen spinoff of the popular Disney+ series. And after watching the footage, we only have one question - what the heck is this movie actually about?

Well, maybe we have a few questions. With the trailer being light on dialogue and heavy on action, there’s a lot we still don’t know about Din Djarin’s (Pedro Pascal) latest mission. Let’s break down the biggest burning questions surrounding The Mandalorian and Grogu and what we actually know about the next Star Wars film. These are the questions we delve into here:

What Mission Has The Mandalorian Been Hired For?
Why Is the Razor Crest Back?
How Big a Role Does Zeb Have?
Who Is the Main Villain?
Is This a Movie or a Long Episode of the TV Series?
title: What the Heck Is the Plot of The Mandalorian and Grogu? Our Biggest Burning Questions

author: IGN
description:
Metalhead comes to Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Splintered Fate. Watch the latest Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Splintered Fate trailer for the action roguelike game to see what to expect with the Metalhead paid DLC, as well as the upcoming free update. The Metalhead DLC and free update both arrive on September 30, 2025.

Metalhead will be available in the paid DLC, which introduces this full-ranged hero as the newest playable character. Metalhead comes armed with a powerful laser gun, explosive landmines and tactical skills to keep enemies at bay. The DLC also features 5 new artifacts to add increased variety to runs. A free update will also be available, featuring audio and visual upgrades, as well as the new Arcade Mode.
title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Splintered Fate - Official Free Update & Metalhead DLC Trailer
